[File: config/src/config/config_optimizer.rs] [Function: NodeConfig::optimize()] [Async safety] If NodeConfig::optimize() is called from an async context, are the synchronous file I/O operations in identity key loading/saving blocking the async runtime and causing performance issues? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/config_optimizer.rs] [Function: NodeConfig::optimize()] [State mutation order] Can reordering of sub-config optimizer calls due to CPU instruction reordering cause security checks to be applied after vulnerable configurations are set, creating a window for attack? (Medium)

[File: config/src/config/config_optimizer.rs] [Lines: 110-152] [Vector growth] The optimizers_with_modifications vector grows with each push - can an attacker trigger all optimizers to report modifications, causing excessive memory allocation that leads to OOM? (Low)

[File: config/src/config/config_optimizer.rs] [Lines: 226-231] [Key generation entropy] The auto-generated identity key's randomness depends on the system's entropy - can an attacker with root access deplete entropy during node initialization to cause predictable keys to be generated? (High)
